test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save settings via direct URL page

steps.action: Navigated directly to module settings URL: /en-us/Home/ctl/Module/ModuleId/363
steps.expected: Module settings page loads with settings form
steps.actual: Settings page loaded with HTML Module Settings section

steps.action: Changed Search Description Length to 250 and clicked Update button
steps.actual: Error displayed: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.'

issues: Saving module settings via direct URL navigation causes NullReferenceException. The modal popup method works correctly, but the direct page navigation method fails with 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object' error.

observations: The suggested test scenarios included 'Configure workflow assignment', 'Enable/disable autosave', and 'Configure form decoration', but code review of Settings.ascx and Settings.ascx.cs revealed only TWO actual settings exist in HTML Module Settings: Replace Tokens (checkbox) and Max length of Description in search (textbox).
Workflow, autosave, and form decoration settings are NOT present in the HTML Module Settings code. These may exist elsewhere in the system or may be features from a different module version.
Direct URL module settings page (/ctl/Module/ModuleId/xxx) has a bug - saving settings causes NullReferenceException. The modal popup method accessed via Module Actions > Settings works correctly.
The 'Reset to default settings' scenario could not be tested as there is no Reset or Default button visible in the HTML Module Settings interface.
Token replacement feature automatically disables module caching when enabled (as confirmed in Settings.ascx.cs code).
